RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since June 10, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 , if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DARLING JOANNA raced on the rail and led through out. SHE'S TAKIN OVER was off a step slow, raced in the two path while saving ground, was off of the pace and allowed to settle, advanced at the half mile pole, improved position and gained momentum, stayed near the fence through the turn and closed on the rail in the stretch, collared one of the front runners at the eighth p[ole and battle the rest of the way home with that foe until the last few strides when SHE'S TAKIN OVER was able to get her head in front and get up for second. LOVERS NEVER SAY raced four wide and vied for the lead through the first turn, settled into a stalking position down the back side, continued to race in the four path through the turn and in the upper stretch, was challenged by an inside closing rival at the eighth pole, dueled with that one into the furlong ground, relinquished near the wire and came away wit third. KENYA STRIKE raced three wide and vied for the lead, settled off of the pace and stalked, raced in between rivals and then had no late kick. GIFTED TALENT raced in the five path around the first turn, settled down the back side, launched a bid at the half mile pole, circled the field through the second turn, entered the stretch and had no rally. PSEUDOSCIENCE vied for the lead, raced in the two path, rated just off off of the pace then fell back.

ENTRY.NAME: Darling Joanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, led through out

ENTRY.NAME: Gifted Talent
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5 wide, 1st turn, off pace, advanced down back side, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: She's Takin Over
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, 2w, inside trip, closed, battled, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Pseudoscience
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, rated, fell back

ENTRY.NAME: Kenya Strike
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, vied, stalked, between, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Lovers Never Say
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, vied, stalked, battled, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 48. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AFLEET CHARLENE was hustled out of the gates, raced on the rail as she set the fractions, was guided down the back side and through the turn with a strong left rein, was given gently urging leaving the turn, was cued wit light encouragement into the stretch drive, responded beautifully and improved with each stride, winning going wire to wire. NOWNOWDANCER vied for the lead from the outside in the seven path, angled into the three path down the backside as she stalked the leader, was challenging and pressuring the leader every step of the way, drew next to the eventual winner at the five sixteenth pole, battled into the stretch, could not gain the lead and struggled to switch leads finishing with second place honors today. ADIAMONDINTHESTORM vied for the lead, raced in the three path and between horsed briefly, gently took back near the seven sixteenth pole as the entered the bend, then had no late kick. GAP DADDY was off a bit slow, raced in the two path on the inside, moved by the half, saved ground through the turn ,closed in the stretch but did not have enough today. GRACEFUL STREET was off a tough slow, raced in the four path in between foes, angled inside in the upper stretch, saved ground, but to no avail. OUR LIL SCANDAL was off of the pace and in between rivals in the five path and was never involved. BOSTON MILLIE raced from the middle of the pack in the six path, advanced position, circled in the turn in the six pat and faded in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Afleet Charlene
ENTRY.OWNER: Beene Linda D and Rowe Stephen
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled, rail, led, lightly encouraged, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Gap Daddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside trip, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Graceful Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, between, angled in stretch, to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Adiamondinthestorm
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, took back 7- 16th, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Our Lil Scandal
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, 5w, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Boston Millie
ENTRY.OWNER: Schmidt Denise and High River Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w, mid pack, circled 6w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Nownowdancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 7w, 3w, pressured leader, struggled to switch leads, 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If de emed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAIN DUDE vied for the lead from the far out side, raced in the three path, got the led, set the pace, showed the way, and got an uncontested win. CROSSING IRIS raced in the three path from mid pack, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, was in contention and battled with another foe at the eighth pole cleared that on at the sixteenth pole was no match for the winner but was second best. THISGUYCANFLY raced from off of the pace, stayed on the rail through the turn, angled out at the five sixteenth pole, shifted in at after the three sixteenth pole, closed well, up for third. PAPIRINGO vied for the lead, was keen in the first turn, raced three wide, chased the eventual winner through the turn then faded in the stretch. WESTERN STAR was off a bit slow, raced from off of the pace, shifted out in the first turn, saved a bit of ground, steadied briefly going onto the backside, angled out and raced five wide, circled in the turn, finished with a mild bid late. MAGIC LIGHTNING vied for the lead, raced two wide and had no rally. JUDGMENTAL raced mid pack in the four path but had no impact. KINGPRIN raced in the three path, raced off of the pace and was never involved. YOU YOUR DADDY SON trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Thisguycanfly
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, shifted out 5-16th, angled in, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Western Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, angled out 5w, circled turn, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Crossing Iris
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, mid pack, bid 3/8, 5 wide, upper battled 1/8, no match4winner

ENTRY.NAME: Kingprin
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pace, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Lightning
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: You Your Daddy Son
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out

ENTRY.NAME: Judgmental
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Papiringo
ENTRY.OWNER: Jarrett Jr Terrell and Lara Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, keen 1st turn, stalked, chased, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Main Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Fontenot Patricia M and Fontenot Kevin B
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w,led, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 13250. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROUD VALENTINE vied for the lead in the two path, battled for the lead with two other rivals, stayed on point and continued to lead from the inside with another on the out side, raced as a set, setting the early fractions together, was cued at the quarter pole and pulled away, waws driven down the stretch and kept on point under hand urging and was able to hold sway. ABBY THE BULL DAWG was off a step slow, was far back off of the pace, was allowed to settle, found her stride, raced in the three path as she improved position and gained ground, shifted into the two path at the upper stretch, had racing room and closed, continued to build momentum with every stride, raced in between horses while passing rivals, had her eye on the leader near the wire but had to much to do to get he win, but ran a very game second. WHAT CAN I SAY raced in the four path and f rom off of the pace, was allowed to settle, moved at the half mile pole, improved position, shifted into the two path in the upper stretch, closed well getting up for third. MISS DARLENE raced in the two path, stalked the front runners, saved ground through out, had a clean trip but finished even. CRYSTAL CRESCENT was five wide and gaining ground from the middle of the pack, circled the field five wide in the turn, shifted down into the three path in the upper stretch, angled back out and had no late kick. PREACH IT GIRL vied for the early lead, stalked the leader from the three path, chased into the stretch then tired at the eighth pole. MOODY RAFAELA showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Darlene
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, stalked, saved round, clean trip, even

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Valentine
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, led with company, drew off 1/4, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Preach It Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, stalked, chased, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Moody Rafaela
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Abby the Bull Dawg
ENTRY.OWNER: Wood David and Dunn John Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, far back, one run, 3w, closed up in time for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: What Can I Say
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, off pace, settled, shifted 2 wide, upper closed

ENTRY.NAME: Crystal Crescent
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, mid pack, circled, shifted in, shifted out stretch,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 99. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 32000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $35,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEDUCTIVE U S A raced from off of the pace, in the four path, launched a bid at the half mile pole ,stayed to the inside and saved ground in the two path, passed horses from the inside through the turn, responded well to urging in the upper stretch, shifted out into the five path as he found his best stride closing the last eighth of a mile, lengthening his stride and getting up intime for a game win. RIGHTANDJUST vied for the lead, raced in the two path and set the pace in a set of three early, stayed on point and continued to lead from the inside drew away from set, entered the stretch and showed the way into the furlong ground, raced on the rail and was kept to task, was almost to the wire but was caught by a fast closing outside rival and just missed. LOGICAL MYTH vied for the lead, raced in the three path on the outside, matched strides with two other competitors to set the early fractions, shook one of the leaders in the turn, stalked the other front runner into the stretch, gave way late. DUKE OF CARTHANIA was off of the pace and five wide, moved at the half mile pole, circled the field wide in the turn, struggled to switch leads in the stretch and finished flat. RUM 'N TONIC was keen early, raced in the four path, rated just off of the pace, then tired. MILITARY BEARING vied for the lean, raced in between other rivals on the lead, stopped after the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Rightandjust
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, led in a set, stayed on point, rail stretch, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Seductive U S A
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, bid 1/2, closed, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Duke of Carthania
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pce, 5w, mvd 1/2, circled turn, struggled to switch

ENTRY.NAME: Military Bearing
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Rum 'n Tonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen, rated, 4w, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Logical Myth
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, led, stalked, gave way late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 10, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TWITTY CITY was racing int the three path from the middle of the field, inched closer on the inside in the two pat and stalked the front runners through the turn, cut the corner and took the lead along the rail, was briefly threatened, repelled that challenger and drew off for the win. FOREVAMO was off mid pack and racing six wide, launched a bid at the three eighths pole and circled the field in the turn still wide, entered the stretch and responded well to urging and encouragement, getting up for second. POST CLOSE was off of the pace early on, raced in the two path and saved ground, launched a bid at the half mile marker and made one run, angled out at the quarter pole, responded to urging by improving position and splitting horses to get up for third. PLATINUM EQUITY vied for the lead from the two path, led, attended the pace, stayed o through the stretch drive but tired late. MR. UNUSUAL was well off of the pace, raced in the four path, circled the field in the six path, struggled to switch leads and finished flat. THE GRAY BLUR raced in the four path, stalked the front runners but never got involved. CARL G raced from mid pack and five wide, circled the field wide but made no impact. ROCKDALE vied for the lead, raced in the three path, rated off of the pace, then faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Post Close
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2w, one run, saved ground, angled out stretch, split

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Unusual
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, 6 wide, turn, struggled to switch leads

ENTRY.NAME: Forevamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 6w, bid 3/8, circled turn, closed up in time for second

ENTRY.NAME: Twitty City
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, mid pack, stalked, bid 3/8, 2w,closed, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Carl G
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack , 5w, circled, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: The Gray Blur
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, stalked, was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Platinum Equity
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w,led,pace, tired late

ENTRY.NAME: Rockdale
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, rated, stalked, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it wil l be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIRST CLASS HARLOW raced from mid pack in the three path, launched a bid the half mile pole, improved position and gained ground, saved ground through the turn, was asked at the quarter pole and responded well, took the lead, was briefly challenged at the eighth pole, repelled rivals and drew off taking the win. HE GOTS TO GO was well off of the pace, raced five wide launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled through the turn, closed in the stretch, in between horses, out finished the rest. STASIS stalked the early pace setter, raced in the four path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole ,shifted five wide in the upper stretch, closed well, just missed for second and settled for third. RANSAM PAYNTER vied for the lead, took the lead while racing on the inside in the two path, set the pace the tired in the stretch. LOOKIN AT BETTY was off slow, raced off of the pace and launched a mild bid late. KISSOFTHENILE raced from mid pack and showed little. COTTONWOOD flashed early speed and gave way. SNAKEBIT trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Ransam Paynter
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, led, set the pace, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Snakebit
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out

ENTRY.NAME: Lookin At Betty
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Kissofthenile
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Cottonwood
ENTRY.COMMENT: flashed early speed, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: He Gots to Go
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pce, 5w, bid 3/8, circled turn, closed, out finished rest

ENTRY.NAME: First Class Harlow
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack, 3w, bid 1/2, saved ground turn, battled 1/8, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Stasis
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, bid 3/8, shifted 5 wide, upper, closed, just missed
